markdownRemark.html:
What is MAPE?

MAPE stands for Mean Absolute Percentage Error. It is used in Machine Learning to help determine how well a model (something that makes a prediction) does at making predictions.

How do I calculate MAPE?

In order to calculate MAPE, you must first calculate the absolute percentage error for each data point. To do this just subtract the actual value from the predicted value, divide by the actual value, and take the absolute value of the result. Then, take the average of the resulting absolute percentage errors.

How do I use MAPE?

MAPE is useful when comparing one model to another. Also, you can decide what percentage error would be acceptable on average and go with a model that is within the acceptable range.

frontmatter.title: What Is MAPE
frontmatter.description: A simple definition of what MAPE is and its general application.
